Text: The next game is roulette!

This time, we'll determine the winner by chip count,
not the number of wins. You win if you have at least
1,000 chips within 100 spins.

Your starting hand will be 100 chips... By the way,
you'll have to pay for your own chips. We wouldn't
want you to get complacent just because it's a game.

Oh, and just so you know, our casino chips are
100,000 zeni a piece. We pride ourselves in being
a high-class casino, after all.

(I-In other words, 10 million zeni?! Worst case
scenario, I may have to go begging to Gamma...!)
Is that around 10 million? No problem.

(She really has no sense of money... The royals are
truly frightening.)

Anyway, I'm sure you have something up your sleeve
for this game, too, right?

...No, it's not that simple. The odds are far worse
for this game.
...Around 94 percent.
Excuse me?

That's the rate of return in roulette. Blackjack, by
the way, is around 102 percent at best.

So, unlike Blackjack, the more you play...the more
money you lose?! That's so unfair!

It's not a charity, so of course, the house has the
advantage. In fact, Blackjack is the rare exception.
Now then, let's begin. Place your bets!
When are we supposed to place our bets?
We can bet now. I'll put one chip on black.
Black? You can bet on a color instead of a number?

Yes, if it's black, I win. If it's red, I lose. If it
lands on green 0 or 00, then the winner takes
all. It's easier to win but with less of a payoff.
In other words, a coward's way of betting?
Watch it...

(Calm down, Beta. Start by placing small bets with
high-probability odds and observe. You need to get
a read on the dealer if you're going to win...!)
Time to spin the ball! No more bets.
The result is...red 11.
I lose. There goes one chip.
Onto the next spin...!
Let's see. So far, it's landed on...

Red 11, red 25, black 6, black 1, red 27, black 29,
black 26, black 17, red 12, and black 8.
I-I'm surprised you remember all that...

That's a lot of black. Don't you think it'll land on
red soon?

It doesn't work that way. It's not like Blackjack,
where you have a fixed number of cards.

Excluding 0, the probability is 50-50 every time.
It may just keep landing on black forever.
Then what do we do? We've got to win...
Betting is about to end...
...One chip on red.

The result is...red 16. Congratulations. Here are
your winnings.

(We've gone through about ten spins without gaining
or losing any chips. This time, the dealer seems to
be consciously randomizing everything to avoid
giving away any tells.)

(Luckily, we've managed to maintain 50-50, but in the
long run, the odds are against us... What to do—)
That does it! I'm betting all the chips on 1!

Huh?! Wh-Wh-Wh-What are you doing?! Dealer, cancel
that bet—

Bets made by your partner are also considered valid.
Time is up, so no more bets.

Brace yourself. If it lands here, based on the rules,
we'll win. Even if we lose, we can win the next
game.

By the way, what happens if it lands on the single
number we bet everything on?

That's a multiple of 36, and since you bet 100 chips,
the payout would be 3,600 chips.

That's a considerable gain. I may have bet a little
too much, but if it lands on 1, we'll be the clear
winners.

Seriously!? I should've expected such outlandish and
reckless gambling from a royal! Not that your family
won't ultimately bail you out!
H-Hey!
A royal...?

I-I meant she acts like a royal...! It's a metaphor!
A metaphor!
...Time to spin the ball.
I'm getting excited!
(Waaah! Help me, my lord!)
